hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Abu Hashim al-Makki, from his grandfather: I heard the Prophet ﷺ say: Seven people will be under the shade of the Throne on the Day of Judgment when there is no shade except its shade: A youth who grew up in the worship of Allah, a man to whom a woman of noble birth and beauty called, but he said, 'I fear Allah, Lord of the worlds'; a man who went from his house, performed ablution properly, then walked to the House of Allah to fulfill an obligatory prayer and died on the way; a man who went for Hajj or Umrah to the House of Allah; a man who went out for Jihad in the way of Allah; a man who went out traveling in the land seeking from Allah's provision to support himself and his family; and a man who stood during the night after the people had slept, performed ablution, then went to the House of Allah and died on the way.

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Abu Hashim al-Makki, from his grandfather: There was a slave girl, half-Arab, who used to pick up filth from the mosque of the Prophet ﷺ. The Prophet ﷺ asked about her. They said: 'She has died.' Then he said: 'For that reason, I saw for her what I saw - indeed she is in Paradise, picking from its fruit.' Then the Prophet ﷺ said: Whoever removes filth from the mosque will have a good deed, and the good deed is multiplied by ten, and whoever puts filth in a mosque will have an evil deed against him, and the evil deed is counted as one.

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Abu Hashim al-Makki, from his grandfather: Three men came to the Prophet ﷺ. He asked the eldest: 'What is your name?' He said: 'My name is Wa'il, or he said Afil.' So he said: 'But your name is Muqbil.' He said: 'O Messenger of Allah, we are a family that practices medicine on our land. Allah has brought Islam, and we dislike treating anything without your permission.' So he said: 'Allah, blessed and exalted, has not sent down any disease except He has sent down a cure for it, except for senility and old age. There is no harm in your administering a cure as long as you do not administer a fatal poison.' Then I said: 'O Messenger of Allah, what is the fatal poison?' So he said: 'That which when taken remains in the belly and kills - so no one should drink it or give it.'

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Abu Hashim al-Makki, from his grandfather: The Prophet ﷺ said: Paradise is one brick of gold and one brick of silver, its pebbles are pearl and emerald, its mortar is musk, its soil is saffron. Its rivers are flowing, its fruits are hanging, and its birds are flexible. There is neither sun nor bitter cold. Each man of its people has a thousand beautiful women, and he remains with the beautiful woman from his beautiful women for a thousand years, never tiring of her nor she of him. And indeed the lowest of the inhabitants of Paradise in rank is he upon whom is bestowed every morning and evening ten thousand dishes of food, each dish having a flavor different from the other. And indeed the man of the inhabitants of Paradise, there passes by him a bird, and he desires it, and it falls between his hands either cooked or roasted as he desires from the desire that entered his heart. And indeed the man of the inhabitants of Paradise is in a garden of his gardens among all types of trees, when he desires a fruit from those fruits, it is lowered to him. And if one of their beautiful women appeared to the people of the earth, she would outshine the light of the sun, and would have caused the people of the earth to be tempted.

Although Abu Hashim al-Makki uses the explicit hearing term 'سَمِعْتُ' (I heard), he was a Tabi'i (second generation) and could not have directly heard from the Prophet ﷺ who died around 11 AH when Abu Hashim was born or had just been born. This represents a clear chronological disconnection.
